tagline: Upgrade from Technician to General and get access to all the HF bands!
notes: 2023-2027 General Class FCC Element 3 Question Pool Syllabus Effective 7/01/2023 – 6/30/2027

sections.summary: General class control operator frequency privileges; primary and secondary allocations

questions.text: On which HF and/or MF amateur bands are there portions where General class licensees cannot transmit?
On which of the following bands is phone operation prohibited?
On which of the following bands is image transmission prohibited?
Which of the following amateur bands is restricted to communication only on specific channels, rather than frequency ranges?
On which of the following frequencies are General class licensees prohibited from operating as control operator?
Which of the following applies when the FCC rules designate the amateur service as a secondary user on a band?

answers.A: Amateur stations must record the call sign of the primary service station before operating on a frequency assigned to that station
answers.B: Amateur stations may use the band only during emergencies
answers.C: Amateur stations must not cause harmful interference to primary users and must accept interference from primary users
answers.D: Amateur stations may only operate during specific hours of the day, while primary users are permitted 24-hour use of the band

questions.text: On which amateur frequencies in the 10-meter band may stations with a General class control operator transmit CW emissions?
Which HF bands have segments exclusively allocated to Amateur Extra licensees?

answers.C: All HF bands except 160 meters and 10 meters

questions.text: Which of the following frequencies is within the General class portion of the 15-meter band?
What portion of the 10-meter band is available for repeater use?

answers.B: The portion between 28.1 MHz and 28.2 MHz
answers.C: The portion between 28.3 MHz and 28.5 MHz

questions.text: When General class licensees are not permitted to use the entire voice portion of a band, which portion of the voice segment is available to them?

answers.C: The lower frequency portion on frequencies below 7.3 MHz, and the upper portion on frequencies above 14.150 MHz
answers.D: The upper frequency portion on frequencies below 7.3 MHz, and the lower portion on frequencies above 14.150 MHz

sections.summary: Antenna structure limitations; good engineering and good amateur practice; beacon operation; prohibited transmissions; retransmitting radio signals

questions.text: What is the maximum height above ground for an antenna structure not near a public use airport without requiring notification to the FAA and registration with the FCC?
With which of the following conditions must beacon stations comply?

answers.A: No more than one beacon station may transmit in the same band from the same station location
answers.B: The frequency must be coordinated with the National Beacon Organization
answers.C: The frequency must be posted on the internet or published in a national periodical

questions.text: Which of the following is a purpose of a beacon station as identified in the FCC rules?

answers.C: Transmission of bulletins of general interest to amateur radio licensees

questions.text: Which of the following transmissions is permitted for all amateur stations?

answers.A: Unidentified transmissions of less than 10 seconds duration for test purposes only
answers.B: Automatic retransmission of other amateur signals by any amateur station
answers.C: Occasional retransmission of weather and propagation forecast information from US government stations
answers.D: Encrypted messages, if not intended to facilitate a criminal act

questions.text: Which of the following one-way transmissions are permitted?

answers.A: Unidentified test transmissions of less than 10 seconds in duration
answers.B: Transmissions to assist with learning the International Morse code
answers.C: Regular transmissions offering equipment for sale, if intended for amateur radio use

questions.text: Under what conditions are state and local governments permitted to regulate amateur radio antenna structures?

answers.A: Under no circumstances, FCC rules take priority
answers.B: At any time and to any extent necessary to accomplish a legitimate purpose of the state or local entity, provided that proper filings are made with the FCC
answers.C: Only when such structures exceed 50 feet in height and are clearly visible 1,000 feet from the structure
answers.D: Amateur Service communications must be reasonably accommodated, and regulations must constitute the minimum practical to accommodate a legitimate purpose of the state or local entity

questions.text: What are the restrictions on the use of abbreviations or procedural signals in the amateur service?

answers.B: They may be used if they do not obscure the meaning of a message
answers.D: They are limited to those expressly listed in Part 97 of the FCC rules

questions.text: When is it permissible to communicate with amateur stations in countries outside the areas administered by the Federal Communications Commission?

answers.A: Only when the foreign country has a formal third-party agreement filed with the FCC
answers.B: When the contact is with amateurs in any country except those whose administrations have notified the ITU that they object to such communications
answers.C: Only when the contact is with amateurs licensed by a country which is a member of the United Nations, or by a territory possessed by such a country
answers.D: Only when the contact is with amateurs licensed by a country which is a member of the International Amateur Radio Union, or by a territory possessed by such a country

questions.text: On what HF frequencies are automatically controlled beacons permitted?

answers.A: On any frequency if power is less than 1 watt
answers.B: On any frequency if transmissions are in Morse code

questions.text: What is the power limit for beacon stations?
Who or what determines “good engineering and good amateur practice,” as applied to the operation of an amateur station in all respects not covered by the Part 97 rules?

sections.summary: Transmitter power regulations; data emission standards; 60-meter operation requirements

questions.text: What is the maximum transmitter power an amateur station may use on 10.140 MHz?
What is the maximum transmitter power an amateur station may use on the 12-meter band?

answers.D: An effective radiated power equivalent to 100 watts from a half-wave dipole

questions.text: What is the maximum bandwidth permitted by FCC rules for amateur radio stations transmitting on USB frequencies in the 60-meter band?
Which of the following is required by the FCC rules when operating in the 60-meter band?

answers.A: If you are using an antenna other than a dipole, you must keep a record of the gain of your antenna
answers.B: You must keep a record of the date, time, frequency, power level, and stations worked
answers.C: You must keep a record of all third-party traffic
answers.D: You must keep a record of the manufacturer of your equipment and the antenna used

questions.text: What is the limit for transmitter power on the 28 MHz band for a General Class control operator?
What is the limit for transmitter power on the 1.8 MHz band?
What must be done before using a new digital protocol on the air?

answers.B: Obtain an experimental license from the FCC
answers.C: Publicly document the technical characteristics of the protocol
answers.D: Submit a rule-making proposal to the FCC describing the codes and methods of the technique

questions.text: (Withdrawn 2024-03-06) What is the maximum symbol rate permitted for RTTY or data emission transmitted at frequencies below 28 MHz?
What is the maximum power limit on the 60-meter band?

answers.C: ERP of 100 watts PEP with respect to a dipole
answers.D: ERP of 100 watts PEP with respect to an isotropic antenna

questions.text: (Withdrawn 2024-03-06) What is the maximum symbol rate permitted for RTTY or data emission transmissions on the 10-meter band?
What measurement is specified by FCC rules that regulate maximum power?

sections.summary: Volunteer Examiners and Volunteer Examiner Coordinators; temporary identification; element credit; remote operation

questions.text: Who may receive partial credit for the elements represented by an expired amateur radio license?

answers.A: Any person who can demonstrate that they once held an FCC-issued General, Advanced, or Amateur Extra class license that was not revoked by the FCC
answers.B: Anyone who held an FCC-issued amateur radio license that expired not less than 5 and not more than 15 years ago
answers.C: Any person who previously held an amateur license issued by another country, but only if that country has a current reciprocal licensing agreement with the FCC
answers.D: Only persons who once held an FCC issued Novice, Technician, or Technician Plus license

questions.text: What license examinations may you administer as an accredited Volunteer Examiner holding a General class operator license?

answers.B: None, only Amateur Extra class licensees may be accredited

questions.text: On which of the following band segments may you operate if you are a Technician class operator and have an unexpired Certificate of Successful Completion of Examination (CSCE) for General class privileges?

answers.A: Only the Technician band segments until your upgrade is posted in the FCC database
answers.B: Only on the Technician band segments until you have a receipt for the FCC application fee payment
answers.C: On any General or Technician class band segment
answers.D: On any General or Technician class band segment except 30 meters and 60 meters

questions.text: Who must observe the administration of a Technician class license examination?

answers.A: At least three Volunteer Examiners of General class or higher
answers.B: At least two Volunteer Examiners of General class or higher
answers.C: At least two Volunteer Examiners of Technician class or higher
answers.D: At least three Volunteer Examiners of Technician class

questions.text: When operating a US station by remote control from outside the country, what license is required of the control operator?

answers.B: Only an appropriate US operator/primary license and a special remote station permit from the FCC
answers.C: Only a license from the foreign country, as long as the call sign includes identification of portable operation in the US
answers.D: A license from the foreign country and a special remote station permit from the FCC

questions.text: Until an upgrade to General class is shown in the FCC database, when must a Technician licensee identify with “AG” after their call sign?

answers.A: Whenever they operate using General class frequency privileges
answers.B: Whenever they operate on any amateur frequency
answers.C: Whenever they operate using Technician frequency privileges
answers.D: A special identifier is not required if their General class license application has been filed with the FCC

questions.text: Volunteer Examiners are accredited by what organization?
Which of the following criteria must be met for a non-US citizen to be an accredited Volunteer Examiner?

answers.A: The person must be a resident of the US for a minimum of 5 years
answers.B: The person must hold an FCC granted amateur radio license of General class or above
answers.C: The person’s home citizenship must be in ITU region 2
answers.D: None of these choices is correct; a non-US citizen cannot be a Volunteer Examiner

questions.text: How long is a Certificate of Successful Completion of Examination (CSCE) valid for exam element credit?

answers.D: For as long as your current license is valid

questions.text: What is the minimum age that one must be to qualify as an accredited Volunteer Examiner?
What action is required to obtain a new General class license after a previously held license has expired and the two-year grace period has passed?

answers.A: They must have a letter from the FCC showing they once held an amateur or commercial license
answers.B: There are no requirements other than being able to show a copy of the expired license
answers.C: Contact the FCC to have the license reinstated
answers.D: The applicant must show proof of the appropriate expired license grant and pass the current Element 2 exam

questions.text: When operating a station in South America by remote control over the internet from the US, what regulations apply?

answers.A: Those of both the remote station’s country and the FCC
answers.B: Those of the remote station’s country and the FCC’s third-party regulations
answers.C: Only those of the remote station’s country

sections.summary: Control categories; repeater regulations; third-party rules; ITU regions; automatically controlled digital station

questions.text: Which of the following would disqualify a third party from participating in sending a message via an amateur station?

answers.A: The third party’s amateur license has been revoked and not reinstated
answers.B: The third party is not a US citizen
answers.C: The third party is speaking in a language other than English

questions.text: When may a 10-meter repeater retransmit the 2-meter signal from a station that has a Technician class control operator?

answers.B: Only if the station on 10-meters is operating under a Special Temporary Authorization allowing such retransmission
answers.C: Only during an FCC-declared general state of communications emergency
answers.D: Only if the 10-meter repeater control operator holds at least a General class license

questions.text: What is required to conduct communications with a digital station operating under automatic control outside the automatic control band segments?

answers.A: The station initiating the contact must be under local or remote control
answers.B: The interrogating transmission must be made by another automatically controlled station
answers.C: No third-party traffic may be transmitted
answers.D: The control operator of the interrogating station must hold an Amateur Extra class license

questions.text: Which of the following conditions require a licensed amateur radio operator to take specific steps to avoid harmful interference to other users or facilities?

answers.A: When operating within one mile of an FCC Monitoring Station
answers.B: When using a band where the Amateur Service is secondary
answers.C: When a station is transmitting spread spectrum emissions

questions.text: What are the restrictions on messages sent to a third party in a country with which there is a Third-Party Agreement?

answers.A: They must relate to emergencies or disaster relief
answers.B: They must be for other licensed amateurs
answers.C: They must relate to amateur radio, or remarks of a personal character, or messages relating to emergencies or disaster relief
answers.D: The message must be limited to no longer than 1 minute in duration and the name of the third party must be recorded in the station log

questions.text: The frequency allocations of which ITU region apply to radio amateurs operating in North and South America?
In what part of the 2.4 GHz band may an amateur station communicate with non-licensed Wi-Fi stations?
What is the maximum PEP output allowed for spread spectrum transmissions?
(Withdrawn 2024-03-06) Under what circumstances are messages that are sent via digital modes exempt from Part 97 third-party rules that apply to other modes of communication?
Why should an amateur operator normally avoid transmitting on 14.100, 18.110, 21.150, 24.930 and 28.200 MHz?

answers.A: A system of propagation beacon stations operates on those frequencies
answers.B: A system of automatic digital stations operates on those frequencies
answers.C: These frequencies are set aside for emergency operations
answers.D: These frequencies are set aside for bulletins from the FCC

questions.text: On what bands may automatically controlled stations transmitting RTTY or data emissions communicate with other automatically controlled digital stations?

answers.A: On any band segment where digital operation is permitted
answers.B: Anywhere in the non-phone segments of the 10-meter or shorter wavelength bands
answers.C: Only in the non-phone Extra Class segments of the bands
answers.D: Anywhere in the 6-meter or shorter wavelength bands, and in limited segments of some of the HF bands

questions.text: When may third-party messages be transmitted via remote control?

answers.A: Under any circumstances in which third party messages are permitted by FCC rules
answers.B: Under no circumstances except for emergencies
answers.C: Only when the message is intended for licensed radio amateurs
answers.D: Only when the message is intended for third parties in areas where licensing is controlled by the FCC

sections.summary: Phone operating procedures: USB/LSB conventions, breaking into a contact, transmitter setup for voice operation; answering DX stations

questions.text: Which mode is most commonly used for voice communications on frequencies of 14 MHz or higher?
Which mode is most commonly used for voice communications on the 160-, 75-, and 40-meter bands?
Which mode is most commonly used for SSB voice communications in the VHF and UHF bands?
Which mode is most commonly used for voice communications on the 17- and 12-meter bands?
Which mode of voice communication is most commonly used on the HF amateur bands?
Which of the following is an advantage of using single sideband, as compared to other analog voice modes on the HF amateur bands?

answers.B: Less subject to interference from atmospheric static crashes
answers.C: Ease of tuning on receive and immunity to impulse noise
answers.D: Less bandwidth used and greater power efficiency

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true of single sideband (SSB)?

answers.A: Only one sideband and the carrier are transmitted; the other sideband is suppressed
answers.B: Only one sideband is transmitted; the other sideband and carrier are suppressed
answers.C: SSB is the only voice mode authorized on the 20-, 15-, and 10-meter amateur bands
answers.D: SSB is the only voice mode authorized on the 160-, 75-, and 40-meter amateur bands

questions.text: What is the recommended way to break into a phone contact?

answers.A: Say “QRZ” several times, followed by your call sign
answers.D: Say “CQ” followed by the call sign of either station

questions.text: Why do most amateur stations use lower sideband on the 160-, 75-, and 40-meter bands?

answers.A: Lower sideband is more efficient than upper sideband at these frequencies
answers.B: Lower sideband is the only sideband legal on these frequency bands
answers.C: Because it is fully compatible with an AM detector
answers.D: It is commonly accepted amateur practice

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true of VOX operation versus PTT operation?

answers.A: The received signal is more natural sounding

questions.text: Generally, who should respond to a station in the contiguous 48 states calling “CQ DX”?

answers.A: Any caller is welcome to respond
answers.C: Any stations outside the lower 48 states

questions.text: What control is typically adjusted for proper ALC setting on a single sideband transceiver?

sections.summary: Operating effectively; band plans; drills and emergencies; RACES operation

questions.text: Which of the following is true concerning access to frequencies?

answers.C: Except during emergencies, no amateur station has priority access to any frequency
answers.D: Contest operations should yield to non-contest use of frequencies

questions.text: What is the first thing you should do if you are communicating with another amateur station and hear a station in distress break in?

answers.B: Acknowledge the station in distress and determine what assistance may be needed
answers.C: Immediately decrease power to avoid interfering with the station in distress

questions.text: What is good amateur practice if propagation changes during a contact creating interference from other stations using the frequency?

answers.A: Advise the interfering stations that you are on the frequency and that you have priority
answers.B: Decrease power and continue to transmit
answers.C: Attempt to resolve the interference problem with the other stations in a mutually acceptable manner

questions.text: When selecting a CW transmitting frequency, what minimum separation from other stations should be used to minimize interference to stations on adjacent frequencies?
When selecting an SSB transmitting frequency, what minimum separation should be used to minimize interference to stations on adjacent frequencies?
How can you avoid harmful interference on an apparently clear frequency before calling CQ on CW or phone?

answers.A: Send “QRL?” on CW, followed by your call sign; or, if using phone, ask if the frequency is in use, followed by your call sign
answers.B: Listen for 2 minutes before calling CQ
answers.C: Send the letter “V” in Morse code several times and listen for a response, or say “test” several times and listen for a response
answers.D: Send “QSY” on CW or if using phone, announce “the frequency is in use,” then give your call sign and listen for a response

questions.text: Which of the following complies with commonly accepted amateur practice when choosing a frequency on which to initiate a call?

answers.A: Listen on the frequency for at least two minutes to be sure it is clear
answers.B: Identify your station by transmitting your call sign at least 3 times

questions.text: What is the voluntary band plan restriction for US stations transmitting within the 48 contiguous states in the 50.1 MHz to 50.125 MHz band segment?

answers.A: Only contacts with stations not within the 48 contiguous states
answers.B: Only contacts with other stations within the 48 contiguous states

questions.text: Who may be the control operator of an amateur station transmitting in RACES to assist relief operations during a disaster?

answers.A: Only a person holding an FCC-issued amateur operator license
answers.B: Only a RACES net control operator
answers.C: A person holding an FCC-issued amateur operator license or an appropriate government official
answers.D: Any control operator when normal communication systems are operational

questions.text: Which of the following is good amateur practice for net management?

answers.A: Always use multiple sets of phonetics during check-in
answers.B: Have a backup frequency in case of interference or poor conditions
answers.C: Transmit the full net roster at the beginning of every session

questions.text: How often may RACES training drills and tests be routinely conducted without special authorization?

answers.A: No more than 1 hour per month
answers.B: No more than 2 hours per month
answers.C: No more than 1 hour per week
answers.D: No more than 2 hours per week

sections.summary: CW operating procedures and procedural signals; Q signals; full break-in

questions.text: Which of the following describes full break-in CW operation (QSK)?

answers.A: Breaking stations send the Morse code prosign “BK”
answers.B: Automatic keyers, instead of hand keys, are used to send Morse code
answers.C: An operator must activate a manual send/receive switch before and after every transmission
answers.D: Transmitting stations can receive between code characters and elements

questions.text: What should you do if a CW station sends “QRS?”
What does it mean when a CW operator sends “KN” at the end of a transmission?

answers.C: Listening only for a specific station or stations

questions.text: What does the Q signal “QRL?” mean?

answers.B: “Are you operating full break-in?” or “Can you operate full break-in?”
answers.C: “Are you listening only for a specific station?”
answers.D: “Are you busy?” or “Is this frequency in use?”

questions.text: What is the best speed to use when answering a CQ in Morse code?

answers.A: The fastest speed at which you are comfortable copying, but no slower than the CQ
answers.B: The fastest speed at which you are comfortable copying, but no faster than the CQ
answers.C: At the standard calling speed of 10 wpm
answers.D: At the standard calling speed of 5 wpm

questions.text: What does the term “zero beat” mean in CW operation?

answers.A: Matching the speed of the transmitting station
answers.B: Operating split to avoid interference on frequency
answers.D: Matching the transmit frequency to the frequency of a received signal

questions.text: When sending CW, what does a “C” mean when added to the RST report?

answers.B: Report was read from an S meter rather than estimated

questions.text: What prosign is sent to indicate the end of a formal message when using CW?
What does the Q signal “QSL” mean?

answers.B: We have already confirmed the contact

questions.text: What does the Q signal “QRN” mean?
What does the Q signal “QRV” mean?

answers.B: There is interference on the frequency
answers.C: I am quitting for the day

sections.summary: Volunteer Monitor Program; HF operations

questions.text: What is the Volunteer Monitor Program?

answers.A: Amateur volunteers who are formally enlisted to monitor the airwaves for rules violations
answers.B: Amateur volunteers who conduct amateur licensing examinations
answers.C: Amateur volunteers who conduct frequency coordination for amateur VHF repeaters
answers.D: Amateur volunteers who use their station equipment to help civil defense organizations in times of emergency

questions.text: Which of the following are objectives of the Volunteer Monitor Program?

answers.A: To conduct efficient and orderly amateur licensing examinations
answers.B: To provide emergency and public safety communications
answers.C: To coordinate repeaters for efficient and orderly spectrum usage
answers.D: To encourage amateur radio operators to self-regulate and comply with the rules

questions.text: What procedure may be used by Volunteer Monitors to localize a station whose continuous carrier is holding a repeater on in their area?

answers.A: Compare vertical and horizontal signal strengths on the input frequency
answers.B: Compare beam headings on the repeater input from their home locations with that of other Volunteer Monitors
answers.C: Compare signal strengths between the input and output of the repeater

questions.text: Which of the following describes an azimuthal projection map?

answers.A: A map that shows accurate land masses
answers.B: A map that shows true bearings and distances from a specific location
answers.C: A map that shows the angle at which an amateur satellite crosses the equator
answers.D: A map that shows the number of degrees longitude that an amateur satellite appears to move westward at the equator with each orbit

questions.text: Which of the following indicates that you are looking for an HF contact with any station?

answers.A: Sign your call sign once, followed by the words “listening for a call” -- if no answer, change frequency and repeat
answers.B: Say “QTC” followed by “this is” and your call sign -- if no answer, change frequency and repeat
answers.C: Repeat “CQ” a few times, followed by “this is,” then your call sign a few times, then pause to listen, repeat as necessary
answers.D: Transmit an unmodulated carried for approximately 10 seconds, followed by “this is” and your call sign, and pause to listen -- repeat as necessary

questions.text: How is a directional antenna pointed when making a “long-path” contact with another station?

answers.C: 180 degrees from the station’s short-path heading

questions.text: Which of the following are examples of the NATO Phonetic Alphabet?
Why do many amateurs keep a station log?

answers.A: The FCC requires a log of all international contacts
answers.B: The FCC requires a log of all international third-party traffic
answers.C: The log provides evidence of operation needed to renew a license without retest
answers.D: To help with a reply if the FCC requests information about your station

questions.text: Which of the following is required when participating in a contest on HF frequencies?

answers.A: Submit a log to the contest sponsor
answers.B: Send a QSL card to the stations worked, or QSL via Logbook of The World
answers.C: Identify your station according to normal FCC regulations

questions.text: What is QRP operation?
Why are signal reports typically exchanged at the beginning of an HF contact?

answers.A: To allow each station to operate according to conditions
answers.B: To be sure the contact will count for award programs
answers.D: To allow each station to calibrate their frequency display

sections.summary: Digital mode operating procedures

questions.text: Which mode is normally used when sending RTTY signals via AFSK with an SSB transmitter?
What is VARA?

answers.A: A low signal-to-noise digital mode used for EME (moonbounce)
answers.B: A digital protocol used with Winlink
answers.C: A radio direction finding system used on VHF and UHF
answers.D: DX spotting system using a network of software defined radios

questions.text: What symptoms may result from other signals interfering with a PACTOR or VARA transmission?

answers.C: Failure to establish a connection between stations

questions.text: Which of the following is good practice when choosing a transmitting frequency to answer a station calling CQ using FT8?

answers.A: Always call on the station’s frequency
answers.B: Call on any frequency in the waterfall except the station’s frequency
answers.C: Find a clear frequency during the same time slot as the calling station
answers.D: Find a clear frequency during the alternate time slot to the calling station

questions.text: What is the standard sideband for JT65, JT9, FT4, or FT8 digital signal when using AFSK?
What is the most common frequency shift for RTTY emissions in the amateur HF bands?
Which of the following is required when using FT8?

answers.B: Computer time accurate to within approximately 1 second

questions.text: In what segment of the 20-meter band are most digital mode operations commonly found?

answers.A: At the bottom of the slow-scan TV segment, near 14.230 MHz
answers.B: At the top of the SSB phone segment, near 14.325 MHz
answers.C: In the middle of the CW segment, near 14.100 MHz

questions.text: How do you join a contact between two stations using the PACTOR protocol?

answers.A: Send broadcast packets containing your call sign while in MONITOR mode
answers.B: Transmit a steady carrier until the PACTOR protocol times out and disconnects
answers.C: Joining an existing contact is not possible, PACTOR connections are limited to two stations

questions.text: Which of the following is a way to establish contact with a digital messaging system gateway station?

answers.A: Send an email to the system control operator
answers.C: Respond when the station broadcasts its SSID
answers.D: Transmit a connect message on the station’s published frequency

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of an Amateur Radio Emergency Data Network (AREDN) mesh network?

answers.A: To provide FM repeater coverage in remote areas
answers.B: To provide real time propagation data by monitoring amateur radio transmissions worldwide
answers.C: To provide high-speed data services during an emergency or community event
answers.D: To provide DX spotting reports to aid contesters and DXers

questions.text: Which of the following describes Winlink?

answers.A: An amateur radio wireless network to send and receive email on the internet
answers.C: A wireless network capable of both VHF and HF band operation

questions.text: What is another name for a Winlink Remote Message Server?
What could be wrong if you cannot decode an RTTY or other FSK signal even though it is apparently tuned in properly?

answers.A: The mark and space frequencies may be reversed
answers.B: You may have selected the wrong baud rate
answers.C: You may be listening on the wrong sideband

questions.text: Which of the following is a common location for FT8?

answers.A: Anywhere in the voice portion of the band
answers.B: Anywhere in the CW portion of the band

sections.summary: Sunspots and solar radiation; geomagnetic field and stability indices

questions.text: How does a higher sunspot number affect HF propagation?

answers.A: Higher sunspot numbers generally indicate a greater probability of good propagation at higher frequencies
answers.B: Lower sunspot numbers generally indicate greater probability of sporadic E propagation
answers.C: A zero sunspot number indicates that radio propagation is not possible on any band
answers.D: A zero sunspot number indicates undisturbed conditions

questions.text: What effect does a sudden ionospheric disturbance have on the daytime ionospheric propagation?

answers.A: It enhances propagation on all HF frequencies
answers.B: It disrupts signals on lower frequencies more than those on higher frequencies
answers.C: It disrupts communications via satellite more than direct communications
answers.D: None, because only areas on the night side of the Earth are affected

questions.text: Approximately how long does it take the increased ultraviolet and X-ray radiation from a solar flare to affect radio propagation on Earth?
Which of the following are the least reliable bands for long-distance communications during periods of low solar activity?
What is the solar flux index?

answers.A: A measure of the highest frequency that is useful for ionospheric propagation between two points on Earth
answers.B: A count of sunspots that is adjusted for solar emissions
answers.C: Another name for the American sunspot number
answers.D: A measure of solar radiation with a wavelength of 10.7 centimeters

questions.text: What is a geomagnetic storm?

answers.A: A sudden drop in the solar flux index
answers.B: A thunderstorm that affects radio propagation
answers.D: A temporary disturbance in Earth’s geomagnetic field

questions.text: At what point in the solar cycle does the 20-meter band usually support worldwide propagation during daylight hours?
How can a geomagnetic storm affect HF propagation?
How can high geomagnetic activity benefit radio communications?

answers.A: Creates auroras that can reflect VHF signals
answers.B: Increases signal strength for HF signals passing through the polar regions

questions.text: What causes HF propagation conditions to vary periodically in a 26- to 28-day cycle?

answers.A: Long term oscillations in the upper atmosphere
answers.B: Cyclic variation in Earth’s radiation belts
answers.C: Rotation of the Sun’s surface layers around its axis
answers.D: The position of the Moon in its orbit
